intro: Commicarpus praetermissus, commonly known as the desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Its seeds are enclosed in a hard, capsule-like structure, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Commicarpus praetermissus is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
